Cuphead

Hand-animated boss-rush platformer. The Tesla build is a taster; the full game + DLC shine at home.

Cuphead is a precision platformer focused on boss encounters with a 1930s cartoon aesthetic. It rewards pattern recognition and tight inputs. If you enjoyed the Tesla taste, the full release at home adds more worlds, bosses, and the Delicious Last Course expansion with Ms. Chalice.

Tesla vs Platform comparison

Tesla version

  • Available in Tesla Arcade
  • Early-world content only; built for short sessions.
  • Controller required: Yes
  • Local co-op: Yes
  • Plug controllers into data-capable USB ports (front/glovebox). Rear ports are power-only on many models.
  • Local co-op works with two controllers.

Where to buy / play at home

  • Green Man Gaming
  • Fanatical
  • GOG
  • Humble Store
  • Amazon (Switch / eShop code)
  • Steam
  • Microsoft Store
PlatformAvailableKey perks / differences
Tesla Yes Plug controllers into data-capable USB ports (front/glovebox). Rear ports are power-only on many models., Local co-op works with two controllers.
PC Yes Full game + The Delicious Last Course DLC, Steam Cloud (Steam), Steam Remote Play Together (online couch-coop workaround)
Xbox Yes Xbox Play Anywhere (one purchase on Xbox & Windows; cross-saves)
PlayStation Yes Full game + DLC; PS Plus cloud saves (within PlayStation)
Switch Yes Full game + DLC; NSO cloud saves (within Switch)
Mobile No —

Cross-saves

  • Tesla → home export supported: No
  • No Tesla → home save export.
  • At home, use platform cloud saves within one ecosystem (Steam Cloud, Xbox Play Anywhere, etc.).

Features

  • Local co-op: Yes
  • Online co-op (native): No
  • Online workaround: Steam Remote Play Together
  • Controller recommended: Yes

Recommended hardware

  • xbox controller
  • ps5 dualsense
  • 8bitdo pro2
  • usb hub

Notes

  • Best home experience at 60fps+ with a controller.
